titlestmt.author: Manuscript, Archives, and Rare Book Library, Emory University

address.addressline: Manuscript, Archives, and Rare Book Library

did.physdesc: 46.75 linear ft.(95 boxes), 8 DVD, and 22 oversized papers (OP)
did.abstract: Literary and personal papers of Irish author Edna O'Brien from circa 1939-2000.
did.repository: Emory UniversityManuscript, Archives, and Rare Book Library

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on access
accessrestrict.p: Special restrictions apply: Subseries 1.5, entire subseries is closed to researchers, including letters from Marie Heaney.
Series 2, Journals, are closed to researchers and Series 5, Subject files, contains some material which is closed to researchers.
Collection stored off-site. Researchers must contact MARBL in advance to access this collection.

userestrict.head: Terms Governing Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: All requests subject to limitations noted in departmental policies on reproduction.

prefercite.head: Citation
prefercite.p: [after identification of item(s)], Edna O'Brien papers, Manuscript, Archives, and Rare Book Library, Emory University.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Edna O'Brien, novelist, short story writer, playwright, and screenwriter, was born December 15, 1932, in Tuamgraney, County Clare, Ireland. Educated first at the local national school and then in a convent, she escaped rural life by attending Pharmaceutical College in Dublin. In 1952, she eloped with Czech-Irish author Ernest Gébler. They moved first to County Wicklow, and then to London, where O'Brien has remained. They divorced after twelve years of marriage, and she raised their two sons alone.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of the literary and personal papers of Irish born author Edna O'Brien from 1939-2000. The bulk of the collection consists of drafts of O'Brien's writings including drafts of her novels, poetry, and short stories. Also present are extensive files of personal and literary correspondence including letters from Samuel Beckett, Harold Pinter, John Osborne, Woody Allen, Robert Graves, Ted Hughes, Saul Bellow, Jacqueline Onassis, Quentin Bell, Sir Ian McKellen, Bill and Hilary Clinton, Tony Blair, and John Major. The collection also includes writings by others (including Harold Pinter), subject files, collected printed material either by or about O'Brien, audio-visual material, and ephemera.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: Organized into nine series: (1) Correspondence, (2) Journals, (3) Writings by O’Brien, (4) Writings by others, (5) Subject files, (6) Printed material, (7) Audio-visual material, (8) Ephemera, and (9) Collected material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The correspondence series in the Edna O'Brien papers includes letters dating from ca. 1939-2000. The five subseries are categories created by O'Brien, which have been organized chronologically. Alphabetical correspondence includes correspondents: Samuel Beckett, Harold Pinter, John Osborne, Woody Allen, Robert Graves, Ted Hughes, Saul Bellow, Jacqueline Onassis, Quentin Bell, Sir Ian McKellen, Bill and Hilary Clinton, and Tony Blair, as well as numerous editors, publishers and press agents. Family correspondents, Subseries 1.2, include O'Brien's parents, Michael and Helena O'Brien (Cleary), her ex-husband, Ernest Gebler, and her sons, Carlos and Sasha Gebler. Subseries 1.3, Personal correspondence, includes general correspondence from friends and colleagues. O'Brien's fan correspondence, Subseries 1.4, contains letters of thanks and criticism from readers of her work. Subseries 1.5 contains the Restricted correspondence of Marie Heaney, John Fortune, David Owen, Peter Reed, and Goran Palin.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on access
accessrestrict.p: Special restrictions apply: Subseries 1.5, entire subseries is closed to researchers, including letters from Marie Heaney.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: Organized into five subseries: (1.1) Alphabetical correspondence, (1.2) Family correspondence, (1.3) Personal correspondence, (1.4) Fan correspondence, and (1.5) Restricted correspondence.

did.unittitle: Personal Letters of Peter Reed and Goran Palin

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The journals series, currently restricted, includes over fifty items, written between ca. 1951 and 1999. Some of the early journals include annotations by Ernest Gebler. Other, later journals include detailed records of O'Brien's dreams, attempts at self-analysis, confessions, and observations.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on access
accessrestrict.p: Special restrictions apply: Entire series closed to researchers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The writings by Edna O'Brien found in the collection include manuscripts of poems, novels, short stories, essays, plays, and screenplays written between ca. 1953 and 1999. Subseries 3.1 includes individual poems, both collected and uncollected. Many of the poems were written under the pen name Dina Bryan. Subseries 3.2 includes manuscripts and typescripts of O'Brien's prose. The short stories are arranged chronologically by collection and alphabetically within each collection; the uncollected short stories are arranged alphabetically. O'Brien's novels are arranged chronologically. The subseries also contains nonfiction pieces. O'Briens essays and short nonfiction pieces are arranged alphabetically and the book-length nonfiction is arranged chronologically. At the end of this subseries are drafts of O'Briens writings for children. Of particular note in this subseries is an early typescript of Girls in Their Married Bliss with corrections and annotations by Ernest Gebler. Subseries 3.3 consists of manuscripts and typescripts of O'Brien's plays and screenplays. O'Brien's published plays and screenplays are arranged chronologically, the others are arranged alphabetically.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: Organized into three subseries: (3.1) Poems, (3.2) Prose, and (3.3) Scripts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Series 4 contains O'Brien's collection of manuscripts and typscripts by other writers. Present are critical writings and poetry about O'Brien as well as creative work by other writers, including Harold Pinter and O'Brien's son, Carlo Gebler. This series is arranged alphabetically by author, or by title when the author is unknown.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: Organized into three subseries: (4.1) Writings about Edna O'Brien, (4.2) Poems by others, and (4.3) Prose by others.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The series contains the personal files of Edna O'Brien. Some of the files, such as the papers from Grayshot Hall Health Centre, Leashold Enfranchisement Association, and University of California, Irvine, were arranged by O'Brien, while others were artificially assembled out of similar materials found throughout the collection. Of particular interest in this series are O'Brien's awards, divorce papers, and memorial service programmes (including programmes for the memorial services of Robert Graves and Laurence Olivier).

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on access
accessrestrict.p: Special restrictions apply: Some material is closed to researchers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Edna O'Brien papers include many collected publications--clippings and entire magazines and journals--with material by or about O'Brien. These printed materials have been arranged chronologically by type: writings by O'Brien, writings about O'Brien, and other collected printed material.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: Organized into three subseries: (6.1) Writings by Edna O'Brien, (6.2) Writings about Edna O'Brien, and (6.3) Other collected printed material.

unittitle.title: Samuel Beckett: As the Story was Told

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The series contains audio-visual material such as audiotapes, videotapes, and photographs. The audio and videotapes include readings by and interviews with O'Brien and are arranged chronologically. Present also are photographs of O'Brien, her family, and others, including Sir Ian McKellen, Jackie Onassis, Ted Turner, and Jane Fonda.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: Organized into three subseries: (7.1) Audiotapes, (7.2) Videotapes, and (7.3) Photographs.

The Queen's University of Belfast, Graduation 1999

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The series contains personal items belonging to Edna O’Brien. Personal materials found in the collection date from ca. 1944 through 1999. Personal items include possessions from the author’s convent school education, including a copy of O’Brien’s sodality manual, inscribed 9 February, 1948. The manual contains a number of prayers, many of which are signed and dated ca. 1948. The collection also contains prayer books and mass cards. Additional items in the series include small gift items from family and friends.

did.unittitle: American Academy and Institute of Arts and Letters Honorary Membership
Madame Bovary programme with notes from cast

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The series contains materials acquired from various sources. It is composed of letters written by O'Brian. For details regarding the provenance of specific items in this artificially assembled portion of the collection, consult the library staff.
